intro: Jasione montana proles maritima, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silvery, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in saline environments. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes or along the shores. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal remedies. Jasione montana proles maritima plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting pollinator populations.
